qas.question: When was a smoking ban passed in the United Kingdom?
In what year did the number of United Kingdom pubs generally start to decline?
Competition from what new form of establishment is sometimes blamed for the decline of pubs?
What business that sells cheap alcohol has sometimes been held to have resulted in the decline of pubs?

context: The number of pubs in the UK has declined year on year, at least since <a1_0>1982<a1_0/>. Various reasons are put forward for this, such as the failure of some establishments to keep up with customer requirements. Others claim the smoking ban of <a0_0>2007<a0_0/>, intense competition from <a2_0>gastro-pubs<a2_0/>, the availability of cheap alcohol in <a3_0>supermarkets<a3_0/> or the general economic climate are either to blame, or are factors in the decline. Changes in demographics may be an additional factor.
